verses.kjv: And the chief fathers of the families of the children of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near, and spake before Moses, and before the princes, the chief fathers of the children of Israel:
verses.web: The heads of the fathers’ households of the family of the children of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near, and spoke before Moses and before the princes, the heads of the fathers’ households of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: The family leaders from the clan of Gilead — who was the son of Machir, son of Manasseh, from the tribe of Joseph — came and presented their case before Moses and the leaders who served as heads of Israel's families.

verses.kjv: And they said, The LORD commanded my lord to give the land for an inheritance by lot to the children of Israel: and my lord was commanded by the LORD to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother unto his daughters.
verses.web: They said, “LORD commanded my lord to give the land for inheritance by lot to the children of Israel. My lord was commanded by LORD to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother to his daughters.
verses.ct: They said, "The LORD commanded you, my lord, to distribute the land by lot as an inheritance to the people of Israel. You were also commanded by the LORD to give our brother Zelophehad's inheritance to his daughters.

verses.kjv: And if they be married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the children of Israel, then shall their inheritance be taken from the inheritance of our fathers, and shall be put to the inheritance of the tribe whereunto they are received: so shall it be taken from the lot of our inheritance.
verses.web: If they are married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the children of Israel, then their inheritance will be taken away from the inheritance of our fathers, and will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they shall belong. So it will be taken away from the lot of our inheritance.
verses.ct: But if they marry men from other Israelite tribes, their land will be transferred away from our ancestral inheritance and added to whatever tribe they marry into. That means our allotted inheritance will shrink.

verses.kjv: And when the jubile of the children of Israel shall be, then shall their inheritance be put unto the inheritance of the tribe whereunto they are received: so shall their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.
verses.web: When the jubilee of the children of Israel comes, then their inheritance will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they shall belong. So their inheritance will be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.”
verses.ct: Even when the Year of Jubilee comes, their land will stay permanently with the tribe they married into. It will be lost from our ancestral tribe's inheritance forever."

verses.kjv: And Moses commanded the children of Israel according to the word of the LORD, saying, The tribe of the sons of Joseph hath said well.
verses.web: Moses commanded the children of Israel according to LORD’s word, saying, “The tribe of the sons of Joseph speak what is right.
verses.ct: Moses gave the people of Israel this instruction from the LORD: "The tribe of Joseph has raised a valid concern.

verses.kjv: This is the thing which the LORD doth command concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, Let them marry to whom they think best; only to the family of the tribe of their father shall they marry.
verses.web: This is the thing which LORD commands concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, ‘Let them be married to whom they think best, only they shall marry into the family of the tribe of their father.
verses.ct: Here is what the LORD commands regarding Zelophehad's daughters: they may marry anyone they choose, but only within the clans of their father's tribe.

verses.kjv: So shall not the inheritance of the children of Israel remove from tribe to tribe: for every one of the children of Israel shall keep himself to the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.
verses.web: So shall no inheritance of the children of Israel move from tribe to tribe; for the children of Israel shall all keep the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.
verses.ct: This way, no inheritance among the people of Israel will pass from one tribe to another. Every Israelite must hold on to the land that belongs to their ancestral tribe.

verses.kjv: And every daughter, that possesseth an inheritance in any tribe of the children of Israel, shall be wife unto one of the family of the tribe of her father, that the children of Israel may enjoy every man the inheritance of his fathers.
verses.web: Every daughter who possesses an inheritance in any tribe of the children of Israel shall be wife to one of the family of the tribe of her father, that the children of Israel may each possess the inheritance of his fathers.
verses.ct: Any woman in Israel who inherits land must marry someone from a clan within her father's tribe. This ensures that every Israelite keeps the inheritance that belonged to their ancestors.

verses.kjv: Neither shall the inheritance remove from one tribe to another tribe; but every one of the tribes of the children of Israel shall keep himself to his own inheritance.
verses.web: So shall no inheritance move from one tribe to another tribe; for the tribes of the children of Israel shall each keep his own inheritance.’ ”
verses.ct: No inheritance is to transfer from one tribe to another. Each tribe of Israel must hold on to its own land."

verses.kjv: Even as the LORD commanded Moses, so did the daughters of Zelophehad:
verses.web: The daughters of Zelophehad did as LORD commanded Moses:
verses.ct: Zelophehad's daughters did exactly what the LORD commanded through Moses.

verses.kjv: For Mahlah, Tirzah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married unto their father’s brothers’ sons:
verses.web: for Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married to their father’s brothers’ sons.
verses.ct: Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah — the daughters of Zelophehad — each married cousins on their father's side.

verses.kjv: And they were married into the families of the sons of Manasseh the son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in the tribe of the family of their father.
verses.web: They were married into the families of the sons of Manasseh the son of Joseph. Their inheritance remained in the tribe of the family of their father.
verses.ct: They married within the clans of Manasseh son of Joseph, so their inheritance stayed within their father's tribal family.

verses.kjv: These are the commandments and the judgments, which the LORD commanded by the hand of Moses unto the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho.
verses.web: These are the commandments and the ordinances which LORD commanded by Moses to the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
verses.ct: These are the commands and regulations that the LORD gave through Moses to the people of Israel while they were camped on the plains of Moab, beside the Jordan River across from Jericho.
